item.title: Report X-2025020662
item.description:
Report X-2025020662

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-17T21:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-08
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UINTED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: NEAR BAY 29 AT THE HAZMAT AUDITOR STATION, AUDITOR NOTICED CORROSIVE HAZMAT PACKAGE HAD A WET SPOT ON A BOTTOM CORNER AND ON THE BOTTOM OF THE PACKAGE. DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS ON THERE WAY TO ANOTHER SPILL WHEN AUDITOR TOLD RESPONDER ABOUT THE HAZMAT PACKAGE HAVING WET SPOT. SINCE THE PACKAGE WASN'T LEAKING OUT OF THE BOX, RESPONDER MADE SURE TO CONTAINERIZE THE HAZMAT PACKAGE AND ISOLATED IT FROM THE HAZMAT AUDITOR WORK STATION.

item.title: Report E-2025020213
item.description:
Report E-2025020213

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-17T21:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-17
  • City: CHICAGO HEIGHTS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0143 ET, BCH notified ERTS about a cargo release inside trailer #3117938. It was reported 5 gallons of carbocoat released from a 5-gallon metal bucket. The caller reported the spill was caused due to a forklift accident. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined terminal personnel can clean the release with PPE on site. The caller reported the spill will be picked up with oil dri and placed into a 20-gallon poly drum. ERTS notified Chem-Trec of the release and spoke to Greg. Greg provided report #2024011700011.

item.title: Report E-2025020178
item.description:
Report E-2025020178

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-03
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) teaspoons of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal pails due to a skid breaking causing the pail drop resulting in it cracking. The released material stayed contained to the box the pail was packaged in. The waste was placed into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025020153
item.description:
Report E-2025020153

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-31
  • City: HAMPSHIRE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal pails due to a packaging failure that resulted in the pail leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 15-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010245
item.description:
Report E-2025010245

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-14
  • City: Chicago Heights
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: US ECOLOGY TRANSPORTATION SOLUTIONS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While employee was loading the material onto the truck, approximately 5-gallons of waste material leaked into secondary containment. The driver was sprayed in the eyes and face while closing the valve. He was able to immediately rinse off with the eyewash and shower and only experience minor irritation from the material (first aid only). Leaked material was cleaned up and sent for disposal. Upon inspecting the tanker, the fitting showed evidence of corrosive damage.
